intro: Androsace sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Androsace sutchuenensis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
